intro: Cyrtandra saxicola, commonly known as the rock cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky slopes and exposed sites, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a rough texture that helps reduce water loss. Cyrtandra saxicola plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
